title: How to Make Grilled Mushrooms in Foil Packets

steps.headline: Cut out four 12" x 12" squares of heavy aluminum foil.
Mix the ingredients in a large bowl.
Use a glazing brush to lightly brush the dull side of the foil with olive oil.
Add the mushroom mixture to each of the foil squares, evenly divided.
Fold over the four square corners over the mixture.
steps.description: You'll want to make a small "teepee" by crimping up and sealing the top.

steps.headline: Grill the packets over a hot temperature, for about 20 to 25 minutes.
Check for doneness.
steps.description: The mushrooms should be tender and juicy.

steps.headline: Carefully add the mushroom mixtures to plates.
steps.description: Watch out for large amounts of juice.

steps.headline: Serve either as a side dish or eat from the foil packets.
steps.description: This is usually a tradition while camping.

text: Cut out four 12" x 12" squares of heavy aluminum foil.  Mix the ingredients in a large bowl.  Use a glazing brush to lightly brush the dull side of the foil with olive oil.  Add the mushroom mixture to each of the foil squares, evenly divided.  Fold over the four square corners over the mixture. You'll want to make a small "teepee" by crimping up and sealing the top. Grill the packets over a hot temperature, for about 20 to 25 minutes.  Check for doneness. The mushrooms should be tender and juicy. Carefully add the mushroom mixtures to plates. Watch out for large amounts of juice. Serve either as a side dish or eat from the foil packets. This is usually a tradition while camping.
sentences: Cut out four 12" x 12" squares of heavy aluminum foil.
Mix the ingredients in a large bowl.
Use a glazing brush to lightly brush the dull side of the foil with olive oil.
Add the mushroom mixture to each of the foil squares, evenly divided.
Fold over the four square corners over the mixture.
You'll want to make a small "teepee" by crimping up and sealing the top.
Grill the packets over a hot temperature, for about 20 to 25 minutes.
The mushrooms should be tender and juicy.
Carefully add the mushroom mixtures to plates.
Watch out for large amounts of juice.
Serve either as a side dish or eat from the foil packets.
This is usually a tradition while camping.
